racos_common¶

This module contains the class RacosCommon, which is a common part in Racos, SRacos and SSRacos.

Author:
Yu-Ren Liu
class racos_common.RacosCommon[source]¶

This class contains common attributes and methods shared by Racos, SRacos and SSRacos.

__init__()[source]¶

Initialization.

clear()[source]¶

Clear RacosCommon.

Returns:no return value
distinct_sample(dim, check_distinct=True, data_num=0)[source]¶

Sample a distinct(compared with solutions in self._data) solution from dim.

Parameters:
  • dim – a Dimension object
  • check_distinct – whether to check the sampled solution is distinct
  • data_num – the maximum number to sample
Returns:

sampled solution and distinct_flag (True if it’s distinct)
distinct_sample_classifier(classifier, check_distinct=True, data_num=0)[source]¶

Sample a distinct solution from a classifier.

distinct_sample_from_set(dim, set, check_distinct=True, data_num=0)[source]¶

Sample a distinct solution(compared with solutions in set) from dim.

Parameters:
  • dim – a Dimension object
  • set – a list containing other solutions
  • check_distinct – whether to check the sampled solution is distinct
  • data_num – the maximum number to sample
Returns:

sampled solution and distinct_flag(True if distinct)
static extend(seta, setb)[source]¶

Concatenate two list.

init_attribute()[source]¶

Init self._data, self._positive_data, self._negative_data by sampling.

Returns:no return value
static is_distinct(seta, x)[source]¶

Check if x is distinct from each solution in seta.

Parameters:
  • seta – a list
  • x – a Solution object
Returns:

True or False
selection()[source]¶
This function sequentially does:
Sort self._data Choose [first, train_size )solutions as the new self._data Choose first positive_size solutions as self._positive_data Choose [positive_size, train_size) solutions as self._negative_data
Returns:no return value
show_best_solution(intermediate_print=False, times=0, freq=100)[source]¶

Show intermediate best solutions every ‘freq’ evaluation.

Parameters:
  • intermediate_print – whether to show
  • times – current iteration time
  • freq – frequency
Returns:

no return value
